channel.title: Help
channel.description: So some people may know www.rsbots.net, it's just as www.autofighter.org what i was wondering is, when you put a "auth" code it activates the script withouth even downloading it, so the script must be in the folder, can anyone tell me where these scripts are located so i can decompile them if you need more info i'll give it.

item.title: Help
item.dc:creator: @Ryanz Ryanz
item.description:
@Ryanz wrote:

oksuper_:

Ryanz, no point; he uses HTTPS (HTTP over SSL). There is a script that takes in several hashes of different files or something and a set of auth codes. The auth codes are in the format PRODUCT_IDxAUTH_KEY. The script parses the product ID, checks if the auth key is a valid key, and if so, it prints out various information on the products. This info is used to build the first interface, which contains list of products you have authed. It then connects to another script which you pass to it a variable named SSID. This number is generated by your IP address. It looks for all products authed to that SSID, and for each one, it passes it on to the packer code. The packer code builds a ZIP file containing all product jars; it is sent from the script and downloaded by neXus, and then the product jars are saved to your temporary directory. In these jars are the classes of the products you bought.

Thanks for the explanation, sorry for the late reply.

Read full topic

item.title: Help
item.dc:creator: @Jython super_
item.description:
@Jython wrote:

Ryanz, no point; he uses HTTPS (HTTP over SSL). There is a script that takes in several hashes of different files or something and a set of auth codes. The auth codes are in the format PRODUCT_IDxAUTH_KEY. The script parses the product ID, checks if the auth key is a valid key, and if so, it prints out various information on the products. This info is used to build the first interface, which contains list of products you have authed. It then connects to another script which you pass to it a variable named SSID. This number is generated by your IP address. It looks for all products authed to that SSID, and for each one, it passes it on to the packer code. The packer code builds a ZIP file containing all product jars; it is sent from the script and downloaded by neXus, and then the product jars are saved to your temporary directory. In these jars are the classes of the products you bought.

item.title: Help
item.dc:creator: @Ryanz Ryanz
item.description:
@Ryanz wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:12, topic:298591”][quote author=Ryanz link=topic=394979.msg2950960#msg2950960 date=1252511700]

unless you have the proper authcode, it won’t download it

Sorry for late reply, but where does it download from? And Lothy, no i don’t have Permission for this, but hey! This is the interwebs.
[/quote]

If you want to know what goes on like where the scripts come from and such I suggest you install wireshark and find out for yourself.[/quote]Okay, i’ll take a look at that, thanks.

Read full topic
